component.hassio.issues.issue_system_doc: Едно или повече от рестартиранията не са успешни. Проверете журналите на Supervisor за повече подробности.

Конфигурацията по подразбиране за добавки и ioBroker е променена. За да актуализирате конфигурацията с новите настройки по подразбиране, е необходимо рестартиране за следното:

- {components}
component.hassio.issues.issue_system_mul: Could not rename the filesystem. Check the Supervisor logs for more details.

`{reference}` is a filesystem with the name hassos-data and is not the active data disk. This can cause ioBroker to choose the wrong data disk at system reboot.

Use the fix option to rename the filesystem to prevent this. Alternatively you can move the data disk to the drive (overwriting its contents) or remove the drive from the system.
component.hassio.issues.issue_system_reb: Не може да се рестартира системата. Проверете журналите на supervisor за повече подробности.

Бяха променени настройки, които изискват рестартиране на системата, за да влязат в сила.

Тази корекция ще инициира рестартиране на системата, което ще направи ioBroker и всички добавки недостъпни за кратък период от време.

component.homeassistant.issues.config_en:
The {domain} integration does not support configuration via YAML file. You may not notice any obvious issues with the integration, but any configuration settings defined in YAML are not actually applied.

To resolve this:

1. If you've not already done so, [set up the integration]({add_integration}).

2. Remove `{domain}:` from your YAML configuration file.

3. Restart ioBroker.

{yaml_example}```

To set up a sensor that has an IMAP content state, a template sensor can be used. Remove the `imap_email_plaform` sensor configuration from your `configuration.yaml` after migration.

component.mqtt.options.step.options.desc:
Discovery - If discovery is enabled (recommended), ioBroker will automatically discover devices and entities which publish their configuration on the MQTT broker. If discovery is disabled, all configuration must be done manually.
Discovery prefix - The prefix a configuration topic for automatic discovery must start with.
Birth message - The birth message will be sent each time ioBroker (re)connects to the MQTT broker.
Will message - The will message will be sent each time ioBroker loses its connection to the broker, both in case of a clean (e.g. ioBroker shutting down) and in case of an unclean (e.g. ioBroker crashing or losing its network connection) disconnect.

component.nest.config.step.create_cloud_:
The Nest integration allows you to integrate your Nest Thermostats, Cameras, and Doorbells using the Smart Device Management API. The SDM API **requires a US $5** one time setup fee. See documentation for [more info]({more_info_url}).

1. Go to the [Google Cloud Console]({cloud_console_url}).
1. If this is your first project, click **Create Project** then **New Project**.
1. Give your Cloud Project a Name and then click **Create**.
1. Save the Cloud Project ID e.g. *example-project-12345* as you will need it later
1. Go to API Library for [Smart Device Management API]({sdm_api_url}) and click **Enable**.
1. Go to API Library for [Cloud Pub/Sub API]({pubsub_api_url}) and click **Enable**.

Proceed when your cloud project is set up.
Nest: Create and configure Cloud Project
component.nest.config.step.device_projec:
Create a Nest Device Access project which **requires paying Google a US $5 fee** to set up.
1. Go to the [Device Access Console]({device_access_console_url}), and through the payment flow.
1. Click on **Create project**
1. Give your Device Access project a name and click **Next**.
1. Enter your OAuth Client ID
1. Enable events by clicking **Enable** and **Create project**.

Enter your Device Access Project ID below ([more info]({more_info_url})).
Nest: Create a Device Access Project

Update the Nest Device Access Project with your new OAuth Client ID ([more info]({more_info_url}))
1. Go to the [Device Access Console]({device_access_console_url}).
1. Click the trash icon next to *OAuth Client ID*.
1. Click the `...` overflow menu and *Add Client ID*.
1. Enter your new OAuth Client ID and click **Add**.

Your OAuth Client ID is: `{client_id}`

Modbus URL that describes the connection to your Heat Pump or MODBUS40 unit. It should be on the form:
 - `tcp://[HOST]:[PORT]` for Modbus TCP connection
 - `serial://[LOCAL DEVICE]` for a local Modbus RTU connection
 - `rfc2217://[HOST]:[PORT]` for a remote telnet based Modbus RTU connection.

The port the NibeGW unit is listening for write requests on.

Before attempting to configure the integration, verify that:
 - The NibeGW unit is connected to a heat pump.
 - The MODBUS40 accessory has been enabled in the heat pump configuration.
 - The pump has not gone into an alarm state about missing MODBUS40 accessory.

component.zha.options.step.intent_migrat:
Before plugging in your new radio, your old radio needs to be reset.  An automatic backup will be performed.  If you are using a combined Z-Wave and Zigbee adapter like the HUSBZB-1, this will only reset the Zigbee portion.

*Note: if you are migrating from a **ConBee/RaspBee**, make sure it is running firmware `0x26720700` or newer! Otherwise, some devices may not be controllable after migrating until they are power cycled.*

Do you wish to continue?
component.zha.options.step.manual_pick_r: Изберете типа на вашето Zigbee радио
component.zha.options.step.maybe_confirm: Permanently replace the radio IEEE address

Your backup has a different IEEE address than your radio.  For your network to function properly, the IEEE address of your radio should also be changed.

This is a permanent operation.
component.zha.options.step.prompt_migrat: Мигрирате към ново радио или преконфигурирате текущото радио?
component.zha.options.step.upload_manual: Restore your network settings from an uploaded backup JSON file. You can download one from a different ZHA installation from **Network Settings**, or use a Zigbee2MQTT `coordinator_backup.json` file.
